name: All About Buckets Quiz | Thematic Objects | 10 Questions

questions.text: On which one of these pieces of heavy equipment would you expect to find a bucket?
questions.explanation:
Excavator.

	An excavator is a commonly seen piece of heavy equipment. It uses a large metal scoop, called a bucket, to shovel large amounts of dirt and debris. Most excavators consist of the bucket, boom and stick which are attached to a rotating cab. They are often used to dig trenches, in mining, and in the field of demolition.

questions.text: If someone says his boss "kicked the bucket", what does he mean?
options: His boss bought a new car
questions.explanation:
His boss died.

	While the origin of the phrase "kick the bucket" is unclear and often debated, the meaning is clear. This phrase is a term for dying. It is a slang term that is neither complimentary nor derogatory, but possibly in poor taste.

questions.text: The 2007 movie "The Bucket List" starred which two veteran movie actors?
questions.explanation:
Jack Nicholson & Morgan Freeman.

	This movie, starring Jack Nicholson and Morgan Freeman received very mixed reviews when it was released to the public. The story centers around two terminally ill men and the things they want to do/try/accomplish before they die. The term "bucket list" refers to a list of these desires that the author of the list wishes to get done before he "kicks the bucket".

questions.text: Guitarist Brian Carroll (b. May 13,1969) has released over 33 albums and performs under which of the following stage names?
questions.explanation:
Buckethead.

	Buckethead is an unusual American performer known for playing the electric guitar while wearing an upside down KFC bucket on his head and an expressionless plain white costume mask. While his appearance is definitely different, he is regarded by many as a very skilled guitarist and performs a very eclectic grouping of music types in his performances. His work includes, blues, jazz, classical, speed metal, and funk rock. He is often mentioned as one of the world's fastest guitar players.

questions.text: What is the best description of a honeybucket?
options: To hold loose nails, screws and bolts
A small yellow and black woodpecker
questions.explanation:
A  toilet or chamberpot.

	In spite of the name, a honey bucket is a plastic (usually) bucket that is used as a toilet. They are seen in communities that lack a water sewage system. The buckets sit under a wooden frame that have a regular toilet seat attached on top. Usually these are 5-gallon (19litre) buckets that are being reused after their original contents have been used. The honey wagon is the term for any cart, truck, or wagon that is used to collect and dispose of the "honey". They are somewhat common in some areas of Alaska and the Yukon.

questions.text: What is another name for a basket crane, a type of aerial work platform found on the end of a hydraulic lifting system or crane that is often attached to a large truck?
questions.explanation:
Cherry picker.

	A basket crane is known by many names including a boom lift, a hydraladder, and a cherry picker. They were originally used in fruit orchards of all kinds but are now often seen being used by telephone companies and electric companies when working on utility poles.

questions.text: Where would you have to go to see the famous Bobrinski Bucket?
questions.explanation:
Hermitage Museum.

	The Bobrinski Bucket is kept at the Hermitage Museum in St. Petersburg, Russia. It is a 12th century bronze bucket that is inlaid with silver and copper. It is one of the oldest examples of an object decorated with Persian calligraphy. It is considered to be one of the most iconic metalwork objects of Islamic art.

questions.text: "Buckets of Rain" was a 1975 song that appeared on which music superstars album "Blood on the Tracks"?
questions.explanation:
Bob Dylan.

	This simple folk rock song was written and sung by Bob Dylan. There are only two instruments in the song, a bass guitar and an acoustic guitar. This simple love song is a reflection of the time in which it was written and sung.

questions.text: The name of the little boy in the movie "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" (2005) is Charlie Bucket.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In this 2005 Tim Burton movie, child star Freddie Highmore starring as character Charlie Bucket wins a trip through the world's most magnificent chocolate factory. Actor Johnny Depp plays the lead character Willy Wonka. This movie is a remake of "Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory" (1971) which starred Gene Wilder in the lead role. The book was written by Roald Dahl in 1965. The first movie was so popular that in 1971, it inspired the Nestle Chocolate Company to introduce its own line of Wonka candy bars. They were discontinued in 2010.

questions.text: Which of the following is the Latin word for bucket and usually refers to very artistically rendered bucket-shaped vessels that were made from 1,000 B.C. to 1,000 A.D.?
questions.explanation:
Situla.

	A situla is an elaborate metal bucket usually made of bronze. They are often found in funerary goods. They can be made of pottery or even glass, but are always highly decorated, and usually appear with a handle. They were made by cultures all over Europe.
